pullRequest.body:
The Ahlswede-Zhang identity is a sharpening of the [Lubell-Yamamoto-Meshalkin inequality](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib_docs/combinatorics/set_family/lym.html#finset.sum_card_slice_div_choose_le_one), by expliciting the correction term.

This PR defines `Finset.truncatedSup`/`Finset.truncatedInf`, whose cardinalities show up in the correction term, and subsequently proves the Ahlswede-Zhang identity itself.

Co-authored-by: Vladimir Ivanov <volodimir1024@gmail.com>


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->
This is a rehash of https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/18612 and https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/18618.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

bors d+
bors d+

```suggestion
/-- The supremum of the elements of `s` less than `a` if there are some, otherwise `⊤`. -/
```
or else this needs some explanation of why the function is called `Sup`
Can you explain why you add `⊥`? The natural choice would seem to be `top`, since that's the inf of an empty set.

This is why it's called "truncated". The theorem is not true otherwise.

Note this was already PRed to mathlib.
Wait, so is this a forward-port PR?
If the intent is not to actually forward-port it, we should just revert it in mathlib3 to get it off the dashboard
I'm happy to make this a forward-port. But note that the second half of the file is not a forward-port
In fact, it doesn't show up on the dashboard right now. So I'd be in favor of waiting for this PR to be merged before adding the aligns.
What is `n` here?
The size of the ground set. Do you have better notation to offer?
I had guessed that, but you can not expect that all readers will, so you just need to tell them: "the sum ... is exactly `1`, where `n` is the cardinality of the ground set", for instance.
And also say that the sum is over all subsets `A` of the space, maybe.

```suggestion
* `AhlswedeZhang.infSum`: LHS of the Ahlswede-Zhang identity.
```
The RHS is `1`, right?

If I understand the code below correctly:
```suggestion
* `Finset.truncatedSup`: `s.truncatedSup a` is the supremum of all `b ≥ a` in `𝒜` if there are
  some, or `⊤` if there are none.
* `Finset.truncatedInf`: `s.truncatedInf a` is the infimum of all `b ≤ a` in `𝒜` if there are
```
